bibl.title: The Form and Structure of the Official Petition: A Study in Greek Epistolography.

series.title: Society of Biblical Literature. Dissertation Series.

bibl.note: M.A. Thesis Vanderbilt Univ., 1968. - Introduction. - I. The structure of the letter of petition. - II. Formulas within the structure. - III. Part III of the letter, the request period. - IV. Summary statements and conclusions. - Appendix [71 letters, arranged chronologically]. Bibliography.
bibl.seg: White John Lee, The Form and Structure of the Official Petition: A Study in Greek Epistolography. (Society of Biblical Literature. Dissertation Series. 5.)
Missoula, Mont., Society of Biblical Literature, 1972, xii-196 pp., 5 tabl.

M.A. Thesis Vanderbilt Univ., 1968. - Introduction. - I. The structure of the letter of petition. - II. Formulas within the structure. - III. Part III of the letter, the request period. - IV. Summary statements and conclusions. - Appendix [71 letters, arranged chronologically]. Bibliography.

C.R. par Mario Girardi, VetChr 12 (1975) pp. 214-216. - Gerard Mussies, ThLZ 99 (1974) coll. 758-760 (C.R. collectif). - Jos√© O'Callaghan, Biblica 55 (1974) pp. 131-132. - J. Pegueroles, StPap 13 (1974) p. 70.
